agency_name: Department for Aging and Rehabilitative Services
series_title: Long-Term Care Ombudsman Program (LTCOP) Activities Case Records
series_description: This series documents the provision of various services by and local staff within the Office of the State Long-Term Care Ombudsman (LTCOP) to older persons receiving long-term care services, including non-casework activities to promote resident's rights and improve quality of care; and the receipt, investigation, and resolution of complaints. This series may include, but is not limited to: releases of information, letters, and case work documentation.
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of federal fiscal year

agency_name: Department for Aging and Rehabilitative Services
series_description: This series documents a client's information and access to term support and disability programs and benefits through the No Wrong Door system. This series may include, but is not limited to: Uniform Assessment Instrument (UAI) and consent forms.

agency_name: Department for Aging and Rehabilitative Services
series_description: This series documents a client's disability and yearly evaluations of the client receiving personal assistance This series may include, but is not limited to applications, medical and vocational assessments, Personal Assistance Services assessment(PAS), and financial information.

agency_name: Department for Aging and Rehabilitative Services
series_description: This series documents start up packets for personal assistants hired to help individuals with disabilities with non-medical activities of daily living. This series may include, but is not limited to: personal assistant provider forms, personal agreements, I-9 forms and documentation, consumer notification forms, direct deposit authorization agreements, forms and VA-4 forms.

agency_name: Department for Aging and Rehabilitative Services
series_description: This series documents a client's request for agency services and the agency's actions and responses made to the request. This series may include, but is not limited to: intake applications, payment requests, invoice authorizations, transportation assessments, monthly vendor reports, lien worksheets, and referral information.
